meanings.definition: To carry or bear a burden on the shoulders.
meanings.sent1: He was shouldering a heavy backpack on the hike.
meanings.sent2: She was shouldering the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The little ant was shouldering a crumb bigger than itself.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was shouldering the weight of countless years.
meanings.sent5: The strong porter was shouldering the load effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To push or jostle with the shoulder.
meanings.sent1: He was shouldering his way through the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: She was shouldering her friend playfully during the game.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was shouldering its siblings in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The waves were shouldering against the rocks relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The football player was shouldering his opponent out of the way.

meanings.definition: To take on responsibility or obligation.
meanings.sent1: She was shouldering the task of organizing the event.
meanings.sent2: He was shouldering more work after his colleague fell ill.
meanings.sent3: The cat was shouldering the duty of guarding the house.
meanings.sent4: The leader was shouldering the hopes and dreams of the people.
meanings.sent5: The student was shouldering the responsibility of completing the project on time.
